CATALOGUE
P jT
\ f C' l t> \
GF THE MOST VALUABLE AND GENUINE
|[(
; ! l COLLECTION
OLSr«lr, Roman, Britifh, Saxon, Englilh, Scotch,
and Irifh,
COINS,
In GOLD, SILVER, and COPPER,
Of an EMINENT COLLECTOR,
D e c E A S E D.
In this Colle&ion arc many of the rareft in the Saxon
and Englilh Scries; lcveral Anglo-Gallic Coins
in Gold and Silver
•,
alfo many fine and choice
Pattern-Pieces by Simon, Biondeau, &c.
WHICH WILL BE
SOLD by AUCTION, By Mr. GERARD,
At his HOUSE, in
LITCHF1ELD-STREET,
St. ANNE's, SOHO,
On T u e s d a y, the 28th of June, 1785, and
the Seven following Days, Sunday excepted.
To be viewed on Friday» the 24th, Saturday, the 2jth, and
till the Time of Sale, which will begin at HALF
after ELEVEN o'Clock precifely.
CATALOGUES to be had at Mr. Gerard's aforefaid.
text.preface:
Conditions of Sale.
I. CJ^HE high eft bidder to be the buyer; and, if any
difpute Jhall arife between any two or more bid ders, the lot fo difputed to be put up again.
II. No perf on to advance lefts than ftxpence; above
one pound, one (hilling ; above Jive pounds, two (hil
lings -andftxpence; andfto in proportion.
III. 'The purchafters are to give in their names and
places of abode, if required, and to pay down Jive(hil
lings in the pound in part of the purchafe-money; in de fault of which, the lot or lots Jo pur chafed to be imme
diately put up again and re-fold.
IV. The lots to be fetched away, with all faults, at
the buyer's expence, within one day after the fale.
Laftly. Upon failure of complying with the above conditions, the money, fo depofited in part of payment, jhall be forfeited the lots, uncleared within the time a- forefaid, Jhall be re-fold by public or private fale; and
the deficiency, (if any,) together with the charges atten
ding fucb re-fale, Jhall be made good by the defaulters at this fale.
